description:
With some time to spare until the reception we were to attend later in the evening we decided to head down Lombard street to Ghiradelli Square for a Sundae by the water.  

We got the Chrissy Fields sundae which was our favorite and it was delicious.  The whole thing was just yummy -  from the soft cookies to the warm brownie to the cookies and cream ice cream to the hot fudge! 

The customer service was great and the speed of our order was perfect.  We found a nice seat with a view of the ocean, our experience couldn't have been better.

The only problem I had was with parking, the structure underneath the square is a pain in the you know what.  If you have a car anything bigger than an economy size expect to have some difficulty.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Angie G.

description:
This morning ,Stopped in for a quick Coffee and a milkshake for my daughter while attending a race at the Aquatic Park.  

Man behind the counter couldn't be bothered from his cell phone. No greetings.. rang us up, still distracted by phone.

Good coffee. Good shake. Too bad...
author: amy m.

description: Great ice cream and service. Nice after walking all day to indulge with a little sweet snack.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Went to the Marketplace shop upstairs but it was too crowded so came down to the street level On-The-Go shop. (This corner shop used to be Boudin many years ago.)  
Ordered Crissy Field - rich cream on top of rich fudge on top of cookies&cream ice cream surrounded by crumble chocolate chip cookie and embellished with milk chocolate caramel mini bars.  We came here because I wanted to show my family this SF icon institution even though I am not a big fan; their desserts are too rich and sweet for my liking.
author: Connie W.

description:
In the mood for a classic ice cream sundae? Then Ghirardelli is the place to go.  Ghirardelli is a classic ice cream place that serves traditional sundaes and a variety of their signature chocolates.  The ice cream flavors are somewhat limited to more traditional flavors.  The one thing you have to get here is of an ice cream sundae of course.

I had the strike it rich Sundae (chocolate & butterscotch)  The taste was pretty good the high light was the warm thick chocolate at the top.  The butterscotch was just alright, unless your a fan of butterscotch your probably better ordering different.  

The chocolate shop offers a great experience for kids and adults alike.  Great experience for those visiting San Francisco.
author: Garett S.

description: How can you not go to San Francisco and not go to a Ghirardelli factory at this location near the pier. This spot is amazing and delightful with super great vibes in this area and on a beautiful day the ice cream the brownies and all the things this factory offers will amaze you. Best part is you walk in someone is giving out free samples or chocolate all different kinds of chocolate they have super long lines so be ready to wait because the things there making here are amazing. They have all different kinds of variety of ice creams with brownies and toppings you can get. They make some chocolate in front of you fresh to. It is super heavy the ice and there brownies and I would defiantly recommend you getting the brownies warm they taste yummy and tasty on the melted ice cream. It is a little pricey but you getting fresh made stuff, with some good chocolate. It's a tourist place to check out and at least try one of there milkshakes or ice cream the brownies or the chocolate. Defiantly a spot people go to when in San Fran. They keep it clean also with the big rush; and they have little stands outside that sell stuff if you do not want to wait in a huge line inside the store. Overall a fun place to take the family enjoy be unhealthy and eat some sweet delicious dessert.
author: Sahil M.

description: VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE! We were inside the shop at 8:57 PM and the staff there kicked us out even though the website says they are closed at 9 P.M. Staff was very aggressive and kept saying get out, we're closed even though there was still 2 minutes till closing. Ruined a family trip from out of town where we never had Ghirardelli Ice Cream. We were very excited to try their ice cream but thanks to the rude staff member, we were not able to do so. Did not have time to go to the other one around the corner due to the extremely long line. Very disappointed in this business and the staff!!
author: Saad G.

description:
So there's 3 ghirardelli shops here, 2 in the square and one down below. We had milkshakes at this one and bought chocolates from the big one upstairs. 

This one was really nice because is wasn't too busy, and they gave us extra free samples! The shop is very small though. 3 of us all a different shake. We had one original, one salted caramel and one mint chocolate. I tried the salted caramel, it was very nice. My mint one was good too but the shake is HUGE and the hot sauce isn't as nice when it goes cold and thick. It also has a rich dark chocolate ice cream on the bottom and mint on the top but I think it would be better us it was all mint, the extra chocolate was just too much for me....me the person who just spent over $90 on chocolate in the store aside from the shakes!!
author: Rowena B.

description: The line was super long and the ice cream was certainly not the best I've ever had. We ordered chocolate and strawberry. Everything is pretty overpriced as expected in a tourist trap.  The center itself is beautiful but I wouldn't wait in line again for this ice cream. San Francisco has better out there!
author: Gar T.

description: Great sundaes! However it is very pricey. We mainly went because it was so iconic. Would go again for the experience, but I know you can find better, cheaper ice cream other places!
author: Cassidy R.

description:
Ghirardelli! Sounds like an Italian name, right?

In fact, this factory takes the name of the founder, Domenico Ghirardelli, and the company is an USA division of Lindt.

Didn't know Ghirardelli was based in San Francisco. I found out while I was walking around the Pier 39 with Ashvini, a dear friend of mine.

The shop was already open at 8am. Nobody was there and we felt it was all for us. I'm kind of healthy person and I live my life sugar-free, therefore I totally removed sucrose from my diet. In short I should have not entered. The eyes see what they see and you are already framed.

Since it was long time I didn't eat sugar, I decided to splurge it flawlessly and I got the most sugary item they had. In one word: DAYUMMMMM! It was delicious.

After long time I had my sugar overdose and I was ready to visit SF and the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Alberto D.

description:
Typical soda fountain. Busy tourist destination, but with quick service. Great if you're in the area,  not worth a trip. 

Ice cream is satisfactory.
author: Noëlle M.

description:
They're pretty slow, like all the time. Even when there's no line - they're slow.

I've gone to this location multiple times and the ice cream always satisfies, but there's always some complication that makes it impossible to get my chocolate and ice cream without waiting thirty minutes or more. 

Last time I was here, their cash registers broke down and they became cash only - literally half the people left the line to go find cash and come back. And then the cashier had to write down all the orders and calculations by hand. Oh man, it was a rough day for everyone involved.

Then the other time I came there was only one person scooping ice cream but a line out the door?? And a ton of workers just walking around the back area. 

And customer service here is just okay. Sometimes I get really nice people, other times they're rude and curt with me because there's a line of people behind me also waiting to order. 

Sigh. I just wish they were a little more efficient and nicer. I'd much rather walk a little further and go to the original shop than hit up this location most of the time.
author: Janice C.

description:
We rushed in out of the California rainy day and the employee at the door warmed our hearts immediately with her smile and free square of Ghiradelli caramel chocolate. Immediately we knew we'd made the right choice by redirecting ourselves to this quick cafe as opposed to waiting in the long line at the higher and larger restaurant in that mall. 

My tween daughter and I proved we are related by ordering very similar versions of the same thing. We both ordered a Quake Shake. Hers was a blended chocolate bar with caramel. Mine was the Sea Salt caramel shake, blending in a banana too. My teen son opted out and simply sipped a soda and sipped our shakes in between. 

Our Three-thumb review is three chocolate and caramel sticky thumbs up. My son was impressed at the distinct flavors. My daughter loved the richness of the shake and the homemade (we think) whip cream. I loved that despite being a "to-go" spot, there was a couple - one of whom was an Iraq war vet inside, we sat outside and squeezed in under the overhang, and another family was there warning up their puppies from the damp weather. Everyone was warming their hearts over frozen desserts and sharing stories with those special to them. We were laughing so hard we could barely breathe over playing 20 questions. It was a blast!

#ThreeThumbReviews #SanFrancisco #Ghiradelli #GhiradelliSquare #Chocolate #Caramel #Dessert #MilkShake #FamilyFun #Vacation #Travel #Blogger #Makesmewander
author: Sarah H.

description:
After you've consumed all of the yummylicious Dungeness crab and Boston clam chowder in a bread bowl at Fisherman's Wharf, head over to Ghirardelli Square to satisfy that sweet tooth. Ice cream and chocolate, here we come!

From the beautiful green grassy area at San Francisco Maritime National Park, you'll want to dash over to Ghirardelli-On-The-Go, grab a dessert for you and your honey, and return to the park to watch the sunset over the Golden Gate Bridge.

The On-The-Go shop is much smaller than the Original Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop also located on Russian Hill. But, it still offers the classic Banana Split, Sundae, Ice Cream Cone, Shake, Beverages, and Chocolates without the chocolate factory feel and capacity for more seating.

I like that they offer Hot Fudge in either Milk Chocolate or Dark Chocolate! I love love love Dark Chocolate. Since it was Easter weekend I ordered the Easter Bunny Sundae for $6.75, which included a scoop of vanilla ice cream, dark hot fudge, whipped cream, sprinkles, topped with a chocolate bunny and six Ghirardelli chocolate eggs on the side. It was delicious. The hot fudge was decadent and the ice cream was creamy and delicious. A perfect treat for anyone not wanting to share a dessert. ;-)

Even though there are only about four tables outside and three bar stools inside, there is plenty of seating within the Square or across the street at the Maritime National Park.

The only downside during our visit was the one man show scooping up ice cream. The cashier moved customers through the line very quickly, but a large number of customers were left waiting & watching in very small quarters. Once this process improves, it'll make for a great experience overall!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Great place to go if you're in the area for a quick hot cocoa or ice cream!

When you walk in, you are greeted at the door with a complimentary square of chocolate which always brightens my day. They always seem to have deals on the chocolate that they sell in store. Often times it is "Buy one Get one Half off." 

I lean toward the hot cocoa every time I'm there. It is soooo rich. If it is too rich for you, they have a water carafe in store. Just like their cocoa their ice cream is rich also and their sundaes are large enough that I always have more than enough to share. They have a ton of seating outside because the store is actually quite small. Definitely a novelty place to go when you're in SF.
author: Athena B.

description: I shared a sundea with my child. Go and see the San Francisco specialty at once.
author: Ai Y.

description: Very touristy but something not to miss when in SF. It's kind of a mad house, be warned! The lines are long, inside is cramped and hectic but your orders come out fast and it is delicious! We waited in the line and I got a cone and my husband got a shake to go. We waited by the counter and a few minutes later we were on our way! Neither of us got one of the fancy huge shakes with all of the toppings, BUT they did look delicious! Glad we stopped by!
author: Andrea R.

description:
What's not to like about this place? A ghiradelli offshoot with a shorter line? I'm there. 

Still the same delicious ice cream and chocolate. So yummy. Same prices and menu. 

They keep it very clean, though if it's busy and you're able to snag a table, it'll probably still have ice cream drippings from the previous patron. 

It is pricey, but that's to be expected from a tourist spot. But really big portions. Definitely meant to be shared. If you really want to be nitpicky, I'd prefer that the brownies come without chocolate chips, but i know plenary of people who prere it and hat and way.
author: Katie B.

description: The hot chocolate and their sundaes are the best !!! Definitely going to miss walking down to Ghirardelli square for my morning hot chocolate .
author: Vanessa D.

description:
I was just here yesterday and man what a mission just a get a damm ice Cream Sunday. My only complaint that ITS SO DAMN CROWDED. You'll be waiting in a pretty crowded line, once you hand them your money you're gonna have to at least wait a few minutes with a whole bunch people around you shoulder to shoulder to get your sweets. The ice cream was great tho.

My suggestion to the manager of this store would be let people go in by waves and not all at once.
author: Edwin R.

description: Have to get the quake shake anytime I go by one of these places.  My current flavor is the banana sea salt but I've gotten other chocolates not listed on the menu in the past & they are all great
author: Just K.

description:
The building/square encompasses a huge chocolate market (pricy but it is very good chocolate and I encourage you to buy as souvenirs) My favorite is the gold tin (2 for $20) which you can pack (smartly) like tetris and get the most of your purchase. Perfect gift!

Check in on YELP APP for a $1 off Sundae coupon.

This whole area is excellent for relaxing and getting some nice sunshine in the grass overlooking the water (walking out of the square) and the golden gate bridge (little far but still gorgeous) is visible.

Bathrooms, benches, shade, food. It's good for taking a break from lots of walking as well. 

Parking is tricky, the tiny parking lot right next to the water is free for 4 hours. After than you need to move. Most is street metered parking but you can try (on weekdays) to park on the slanted Larking St (free) but you also need a bit of luck. Bring lots of quarters for the meters. 

Lots of tourists and shops to rent a bycicle there as well. Another excellent place to visit on your first time in SF.
author: Graciela C.

description: Best chocolate in town. They also use a great creamy ice cream to go together with the hot fudge. The hot fudge Sunday is the best along with the banana split. You can't go wrong with any selections. They a e by far better then any other ice cream parlor around.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Had the salted caramel sundae and oh my goodness it was delicious! 
Definitely recommend.
author: Mayumi H.

description:
There are three locations in the Ghirardelli square and lines  are long on weekends so go down stairs which seems to have the shortest line. 
They sundaes are about $10 to $13 and they are very heavy and hard to finish by yourself so make sure to share! The size of the cup is pretty small but the fudge really fills you up. 
We got the vanilla and milk chocolate fudge with brownie sundae which was amazing! The brownie was very moist and went perfectly with the vanilla ice cream.  There was also a good amount of fudge in the middle and bottom of the cup.  
I think this place is better than the one I had at Ghirardelli factory in California adventure in socal. 
Be sure to check in for a dollar off and try the sea salt chocolate sample! 
If you save your receipt you can get 10% off your next purchase!
author: Judy L.

description: Good milkshakes - nothing like out of this world but it was good. The food is PRICEY - like $11 for a sundae pricey! We got three milkshakes and two scoops in a cone for more than $30. The quake shakes were good. The banana one was so/so. That said, it was fun to go here since it is local to San Fran. The line to order moved fast but it took just as long to get our ice cream as it did to order (about thirty minutes total).
author: Cara T.

description: Great experience!!  Josiah was very helpful in making my decision easy.  Offered samples to make sure I liked what I was buying.  Also excited to see different options and new flavors.  It was quick and easy in and out and I got exactly what I needed.  My kids enjoyed the stop as well.  Definitely recommend!!
author: Lora M.

description:
The brownie sundae was AMAZING!...but for a damn 13 dollars it better be. 
Happy I was able to enjoy the San Francisco sun, with my favorite person, and a really delicious brownie sundae. Yum.
author: Rindy N.

description: Looooong lines. Why? Because the staff take their sweet time, they are annoyingly slow. Were they told to do so, so that the huge line outside of the shop?
author: Lucky O.

description:
This place is one of the must visit places in SF. It is usually very crowded but the desserts they serve is worth the wait . I would suggest sharing a dessert with another person unless you have the appetite the whole thing !! 
We ordered a variety of stuff and most of them tasted good !!
author: Anand S.

description: Great guilty pleasure!  If it is chilly treat yourself to the Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate.  It is probably 2 zillion calories but you can walk it off enjoying a stroll down by the water.  Friendly, nice service, and they don't rush you while you are contemplating what goodie to get.
author: Heather D.

description:
While we were in San Francesco, we had to make the trip to Ghirardelli. We were within walking distance of Ghirardelli Square which was fantastic and convenient. However, Ghirardelli Square is undergoing major renovations, and the original Ghirardelli shop was closed and the Ghirardelli-On-The-Go was our only choice.  

Thus, a super long line was forming around the corner and people were waiting for two hours for their chocolate fix. While we were waiting we had an incredible view of the bay, and the trolley cars. We were also given free chocolate samples for our patience. 

When we finally got inside, because of the long lines, we were only able to purchase ice cream. My in-laws and hubby ordered hot fudge sundaes and I ordered the caramel candy bar shake. We had to wait another 20 minutes for our sundaes. 

When the orders were ready, they had made mine wrong (without caramel) but after waiting for 2 hours, I was not going to wait another 20 minutes for the correct shake to be made. In hindsight, I probably would not order a shake again, at least not the candy bar shake. The texture was strange and the bits of chocolate all sunk to the bottom which was hard to sip up with the straw. 

The ice cream sundaes, on the other hand, were delicious. I loved the hot fudge. While it was neat going to the actual Ghirardelli store on Ghirardelli Square, it was not worth the wait.
author: Rachel R.

description:
So you should go to this location if you just want a cone with single or double scoop.

 Don't come here for sundae. 

Hit the Marketplace for sundaes cuz this quickie operation is operating at a fast pace to pump out lackluster, minimal scoop confections.

The sundaes I saw in the Marketplace were exquisite by comparison.

So if you're splurging make sure to hit up the right spot! 


 they'll give you heaping scoops in your cone.
author: Katja D.

description:
My Girlfriend and I did a weekend getaway to San Francisco and visited here on a very long walk and sight seeing adventure.  We both assumed this would be awesome to visit and buy a great dessert.  

In summary, my recommendation would be visit for a one time "I have been there" but that is about it.  The customer service completely lacked, on our visit at least.  And the chocolate topping on the ice-cream was so overly frozen (Not sure if it was the ice-cream or chocolate), that it made it not as enjoyable as it should have been for the cost.  Talking with people sitting outside, they had similar comments.

The seating outside was horrible.  Most of the seating was taken up by non-customers just saving seats for family walking around....
author: Manny S.

description: WOW! Espresso Escape is a 4 Star! You really can't go wrong with anything here, it's all pretty good so you may need to go back a few times but I guess that's not a bad thing if you like Ice Cream.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Hi my name is Gloria and I'm a Chocaholic! 

Omg this this shop is a chocolate lovers dream! Ghirardelli chocolates everywhere!!! Their menu is on a oversized page filled with all sorts of flavors of ice cream and the many things they could do with it! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ghirardelli-on-the-go-at-ghirardelli-square-san-francisco?select=zZyAGy_bAkPamhTSvX0yWw

I opted for something simple to share with my son because I wanted him to experience everything while in SF including forcing him to eat ice cream! You must be thinking what kid doesn't like ice cream...well my kid right here! So I got two scoops in a waffle bowl with chocolate for me and chocolate chip cookie dough for him! After you place your order you can watch them make your concoction and since I was simple my bowl was ready quite quickly. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ghirardelli-on-the-go-at-ghirardelli-square-san-francisco?select=2cxfJ7zt63WdpClZxFzutw
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ghirardelli-on-the-go-at-ghirardelli-square-san-francisco?select=aSaixsO7hsgRyNrLm1GwGg

We grabbed a table outside and dove right in. The ice cream was creamy and rich! I absolutely L-O-V-E-D the ice cream and my son who isn't an ice cream lover was impressed. And coming from him that is miraculous!!! The waffle cone is dipped in Ghirardelli Dark Chocolate and is a perfect combo with the ice cream. I do wish I would have grabbed a couple of their other treats like their oversized cookies or brownies but after all the goodies we had tried we were not able to eat anymore. I did grab some squares of chocolate to bring home to my pops! 

So why only 4 stars...it can get a bit pricey and if you see their menu of items you know why! All in all Ghirardelli is definitely a must try!!!
author: Gloria R.

description: The chocolate is great, however, they have a scale in the shop so that you know how much chocolate you are buying.  The scale max's out at 1 pound. (But the scale goes up to 4 pounds)  I thought I was buying multiple 1 pound bags at $19.99 a pound.  NOT.  When you get to the counter, you discover that your bags are each over 2 pounds.  They deceive you with that scale on purpose.  Either remove the scale completely or just put a 1 pound scale, don't try to cheat your customers.
author: Gayl D.

description: This is a quintessential experience more than anything else. Had much better (and less expensive) ice cream back home. Do it because it IS San Fran.
author: S T.

description: Love coming to this place. I have to admit, I was kind of bummed that the main part of the place was closed off for renovation, but that's not going to stop me from buying ghirardeli chocolate.  I love it! I love all of the delicious feelings, especially the mint! I also love that it's real chocolate without any corn syrup! Wish I lived in San Francisco and could come here every week, but that probably would not be a good idea for my waistline.  They do need to fix their cash register system. There was a lot of confusion amongst the customers regarding where the line was and depending on who was at the cash register, the line moved around. This was a little frustrating.
author: Alice S.

description:
this is very disturbing, i want you guys to behave better.

my very close friend and her husband just visited san francisco for the first time super excited and went to the ghiradelli today and got super mad by the walkout,

this lady with glasses(red frames) who had a basket of free chocolate samples offered every customer one per person, but my friend couple didnt get one, so she asked for one and she had this weird gesture and face and gave her one, when this german family right before her had one each person without asking for it.

so she got a little annoyed,

and then when she went to the casher to pay, this lady with glasses, gave the asian casher a weird gesture and the casher mockingly giggled at her, i mean, there were no people at her behind, and giving signs to each other to shit on customers is beyond disturbing.

my friend is a very classy woman, who is not even aggressive, never gets mad, and speaks good english, i never had seen her getting mad or any, not even once,

i am pretty sure these words could never possibly describe how terrible she felt by the customer service, she will be in the city for a few more days but she is never going back, i suggested her a gourmet place instead, because i dont want her to experience this shit again,

you guys should educate your employees for better customer service for sure.

she says she had the WORST Christmas Eve because of your service here.

(im only translating what she asked me to say)
author: Jaesang C.

description: Major tourist attraction.  A must visit for chocolate lovers but run know that and charge you accordingly. Got a free sample while waiting in line though!  Got the chocolate painted lady sundae it was good.you wait on line to order and then wait twice as long to get your treat. Can't say how it compares to the main location around the corner but this location definitely has less space.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Great place to get dessert, coffee, sit down and talk after dinner. The view on the Bay is gorgeous.  The tables with the fire places are awesome, cozy and perfect to sit down have a cup of coffee and talk. 

This is one of the main attractions in SF for either native residents or visiting tourists.  It's a must to try.
author: Ahmad A.

description:
This is the location to go to avoid the lines except in heavy tourist season. The main restaurant was really busy and vacant tables were sticky so we decided to give up on the quest for the salted caramel or hot fudge sundae and then discovered this location once we made our way down the steps. This one is oceanfront and it had no lines at all. Free samples to boot! Score!

I wasn't hungry after a large meal but my daughter's sundae was so tempting that I ended up "tasting" quite a bit. The flavor was exactly like the one in the "Original" store upstairs. Get anything salted caramel or hot fudge and it's a delicious sundae. Forget about the prices, it's a once in a while treat!

The service is always nicer when there is not a long line involved. The girls at the counter seemed tired but were polite and we had a good experience. I love the sundaes at Ghirardelli, but not in the sticky, kids crying ambiance upstairs so this was a nice find!
author: Anjana A.

description: Easy breezy & chocolate. Small black coffee $2.25 & free sample yes! Small inside & outdoor seating. No line but does get packed. It is expensive chocolates
author: Rose B.

description:
Nice spot for kids on a cold day/evening 
Free chocolate samples upon arrival but might have only been during the holidays
You order and then find seats and wait for your order to be brought over to you 
Service was good considering there were screaming children everywhere
author: Sarah G.

description:
While the ambiance of this Ghirardelli shop has more to be desired, I still love their sundaes! The warm hot fudge is excellent even with the cold icecream - both on hot and cold days in the city.

Tip: The sundaes are pretty large so if you're looking for just the standard one, order a single cup and just add the hot fudge and whipped cream toppings. Perfect for portion control for someone like me who just can't stay away from sweets. Enjoy!
author: Keri N.

description: Visited on a Saturday and it was PACKED.  I am sure I waited over 20 minutes (and probably closer to 30 minutes) to order and get my sundaes.  Both the salted caramel sundae and the hot fudge sundae were delicious!
author: C C.

description: Worst service ever. Was there 7/29/2017.   Waited in line for about 20 minutes just to order, then waited another 30 minutes to get melted Edy's ice cream with minimal toppings, scant whipped cream and no cherries on top.  People in line in front of me never got their order prior to me walking out, and people behind me got their order before me.  Restaurant itself had no tables and was too overcrowded for the fire codes, and the cashiers kept telling people to move down.  Talk about sardines in a can.  Two managers on duty, watching the staff struggling to keep up, and not attempting to assist.  Better of going down the street to the Dreyer's/Edy's store to get the same ice cream at 1/2 the cost!!!
author: Doc B.

description:
Ghirardelli -- a chocolate lovers dream. I've been to the Ghirardelli shop in San Diego but this one definitely has more of a pizzazz factor due to it's history and the fact that you can still see the original chocolate manufacturing equipment. 

This place gets very, very, VERY busy. There always seems to be a line whenever I've been here and finding a table can be a little bit tricky.  They have a large menu to choose from and I usually get a small drink and a dessert to share.  The desserts are good but nothing out-of-this-world mind blowing. I think the experience is what makes everything taste better. 

My last visit I ended up waiting a very long time for my drink. We got our dessert and the bf pretty much finished his drink before I got mine. I went up to ask and it was sitting right on top of the counter. Apparently I hadn't heard the gentleman behind the counter when he had called my order. He was nice and re-made my order to-go. I think this is a nice place to visit if you've never been.
author: Tina M.

description: What a splendid way to spend a Sunday. We sat by the fountains and sipped Bailey coffee. To the right, we strolled to find a guy playing the viola. I asked him if he ever considered the relationship between violas and violins similar to Ron opie Cunningham and his younger brother: both struggling for recognition but one not so much. He did not get it for his response was violas have a deeper robust tone. He was good at classical Clare de lune by Claude Debussey. Later, we wandered into this old magic shop. There I purchased are solid metal hand buzzer with solid spring action. Buzzing people is what I specialize in doing
author: Steve B.

description:
You get two free samples of milk chocolate caramel squares! 

More importantly, the ice cream we got was just okay. We shared the chocolate chip ice cream on a cone, but the ice cream had some bad freezer burn. Ice crystals were forming everywhere.

Move along; there's not much to see here.
author: Jerry B.

description:
It was a cold, windy February day when I stopped here. Not the best weather for ice cream, but dang it, I wanted to be able to say I had a sundae at Ghirardelli Square. 

I enjoyed it, but I somehow expected more. Maybe slightly friendlier workers and a more inviting shop? 

It's worth a visit, but I'd probably not go back. It's one of those "been there, done that" deals.
author: Janet V.

description:
Unsatisfying!!!!

My friends ranted & raved about the brownie sundae so my sister and I went there to try it. 

I was picturing a huge brownie covered in chocolate with a spoon full of ice cream. 

What we got was a little ice cream, a lot of whipped cream, some chocolate syrup and the world's smallest brownie. 

And... the glass was completely deceiving, designed to make it look like you're getting more than you really do.

A complete disappointment to my hungry belly!!!
author: AnneMarie W.

description:
Uninspired, they let our ice cream sit before delivery so it melted a bit. The place is a madhouse. It's in a major tourist area, you have to circle the place like a vulture to get a table, and you aren't the only one circling and there is no way to track who gets what (no numbers, lines, anything).

The ice cream is OK, nothing really to be excited about.  The hot fudge is really good though. Because it's Ghirardelli I think the tourists have to visit it, but if you are a local you are better off at somewhere like Knudsons in Castro Valley or Fenton's Piedmont.
author: Sean S.

description: Nice spot to grab a hot chocolate at a cold day. Employees were polite. The cookies were no bueno. The area itself is nice to visit as well.
author: Robert G.

description: Ice cream was great! The chocolate was great! The line was worth the wait! I highly recommend the cookie crumble if your ever in the area.
author: Larissa S.

description:
A short walk from Fisherman's Warf and into this small cafe & shop offering decadent goodies.

On walking in, the friendly server behind the counter offered a sampling of their chocolates to my group.

Not normally a fan of sweets, I opted for a childhood fav and indulged in their Banana Split.  Maybe cause it's been a while but this maybe the best I've had.  Rest of my group had sundaes with various toppings and on sampling, they were equally delish!

The servings are fairly large and good to share.

This is a small shop with larger ones located within the square and up the stairs.

A good way to calm a nice walk after crab & chowder from the warf.
author: David P.

description: We went to this location in late summer for some sundaes. First of all the location was so insanely busy it took us 45 minutes to get two sundaes. I'm not knocking them for that because they can't control how busy it was. However, the sundaes we got were terrible. I had the mint bliss. The hot fudge had a funny taste to it and the whipped cream they used left a coating in my mouth. My friend had the sea salt caramel sundae. It was basically all salt. We are both ice cream lovers and we both ended up tossing them in the trash they were so bad. I don't recommend this location!
author: Dan M.

description:
I've been here quite a few times and always love coming here. Such a wonderful spot to stop in for dessert following a meal. 

Besides it being an iconic spot for chocolate (which btw they give you freebies just for stopping in), this place puts together some delicious ice cream sundaes. 

I always stick with the mint bliss, which comes in a cup with a scoop of mint and a scoop of chocolate on the bottom. It's then smothered in hot fudge. Super delicious. Whatever your tastes, you'll find it here. Just hope that you avoid a gigantic line, as this place can sometimes get very busy.
author: Paul S.

description:
Mmm dessert! Whenever I'm in the touristy part of SF, I like to make a pitstop here to grab something delicious and sugary (not to mention their store next door gives free samples of their chocolate! Yippee, free chocolate). 

It's a cute soda fountain that usually has a long line, and the seating indoors gives a sorta old school feeling which is kinda cool. You read the menu outside or grab a large paper menu and order at the counter and find a place to sit with a number and somebody comes up to you and gives you your oh-so delicious dessert.

First thing I've ever had here was the root beer floats and other times I got the cable car and some sundae. I like the presence of the dessert; sometimes it's almost too pretty to eat! Everytime I come here, I'm always satisfied with the quality of ice cream. I love how much of a selection they have here. Even though I usually end up a bit too full, I have to down a few cups of water because it's preeetttyyyyy sweet.. maybe a bit too sweet for some people.

Pricing? It can be slightly overpriced, but usually one will end up really full after eating one sundae (hence, maybe half a sundae like me). Also probably because this is a popular tourist attraction so I'm not surprised with the prices.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Never ever order the NOB HILL CHILL. It is supposed to be a milkshake....what it was a $10.12 disappointment. This price includes tax. Did not expect such a horrible milkshake experience at Ghirardelli. Attaching a pic of the rather normal looking shake. Taste however was HORRIBLE.
author: K F.

description:
The place is pretty big and the ice cream parlor has a patio, shop, and drinks section. The seating outside is beautiful; even though, it was raining... =] 

I ordered the caramel and very berry sundae in a chocolate dipped waffle bowl. The caramel sundae is by far my favorite! There was a lot of caramel from top to bottom! The vanilla ice cream was delicious! Of course you can't forget the milk chocolate Ghirardelli square that was placed behind the ice cream. Very cleaver to hide away from getting eaten... =P (Saved it for last) MMM! The bad thing about this was that the waffle bowl was not baked freshly and it was broken so everything leaked out quickly. The very berry sundae tasted very healthy; even though, I know it wasn't. There was candied blueberries on top that tasted very good! The ice cream was smooth and when mixed together with the berry syrup sauce, it tasted really good. 

Obviously, I would recommend this place! Love sugar...I mean this place. =]
author: Connie C.

description: Really slow, disorganized, and expensive. Line out the door and only one guy scooping.
author: Doug C.

description:
Over rated. 
Let's be real. And that's what I can only be.

Be prepared to..
Wait in a long line.
Horrible service.
Get ripped off.

Upstairs is closed to appear packed and crowded downstairs.

Obtain your own seating, get into arguments with others over chairs.

The Server is the busser so watch as they clean a table after you ask them nicely and receive an "eye roll" with attitude along with it, then use the SAME glove to add your cherry or chocolate piece to your sundae at the end....with attitude!! I'd fire this employee in front of his/her parents.

I believe they hire with out a Safety Course Certification. 

WWW.STATEFOODSAFETY.COM

Watch as the unattended chocolate fountain area in the back get touched by children licking delicious chocolate with their fingers.

Get treated like a tourist like they'll never see you again so who gives a bs service.

I saw a guy joking around with one of the other desert creators and threw a dirty rag at him, then saw an object get flicked onto someone's desert.

I guess when they get lazy to actually create a masterpiece like the picture on the menu they resort to little starbucks looking cups. This becomes half of what you order and simply - YOU GET RIPPED OFF. That happened to us. 4 little plastic kiddie cups of desert at $10+ each. It was so bad that they jacked up a couples order as well, the girlfriend had a the right one done in a real desert tall glass and then they had the nerve to give the boyfriend the small baskin robbins cup! Dammm you know I had to instigate this one. He got up and complained.

Yeah I know I'm rippin this place a new one, it was my good friends birthday that day and nobody should be having a bad one ever.

(Please see the picture provided of the plastic cup service, complained by another customer, which was then made right on the glass real version.)

The only pleasant experience I had here was the wonderful polite and cheering greet from the front register ladies and the the girl giving free samples at the gift shop next door.

To management, you may not give a rats ass, keep making your commissions and quotas but yelp community really actually read up on these reviews and it does effect there choices.

....I'm also going to upload the pictures of our presentation cups of desert and in comparison, I just wanted to post this review up 1st.
author: Jojo C.

description: The best ice cream / chocolate restaurant ever. Cable car sunday. Whooooo. Get a cookie its 4 bucks or so but worth it. Sp good. Never been so full in my life after coming here after eating at tommys joynt.
author: Samuel M.

description:
The 4th of July I had the worst ice cream experience I have ever had. It was the 4th of July, they were really busy. They had two people running the register and 2 people making orders. Obviously it takes less time to take an order than make one. After waiting 20 minutes to order we waited 30-40 minutes to get it. 3 scoops of ice cream and a hot chocolate. When the order finally came they left out a scoop and argued for a minute and exchanged cuss words until they finally decided to give the scoop. After walking out, we realized it was the wrong flavor. 30+ minutes for an order of ice cream! it better be right. 
I think this stems down to poor management, they needed more people working in there.  I don't advise going here on a holiday
author: Andrew R.

description: I think this place is very over-hyped. Yes it's Ghirardelli, but root beer float should not cost this much. If I got a sundae with their chocolate in it, then I agree that it should be more pricey. My friend got a scoop of their Ghirardelli chocolate and I have to admit that it was good, even for a person not a fan of chocolate. However, this review is about their root beer float that cost me way more than what a scoop of vanilla ice cream and root beer should cost.
author: Melanie H.

description: Best ice cream in California to date in history a bit messy  but the ice cream makes up for it
author: Davis B.

description:
This not so little ice cream shop was awesome. My girlfriends and I ordered the hot fudge sundae and a banana split. The hot fudge sundae although I only had like 2 bits because my other friends were eating it so fast like there's no tomorrow was very good. The fudge itself was delicious. The banana split was also very good. For my friend who doesn't usually like and eat dessert, ate half the order. That gotta mean it's GOOD. 

I wish this place exist in OC. I would definitely come back.
author: Nikki N.

description:
For couples watching their caloric intake, I recommend getting the Chocolate dipped waffle bowl version of the Hot chocolate fudge sundae. It is definitely smaller compared to all the tall sundaes and satisfies that sweet craving fo sho! 
The hot chocolate fudge is luscious, smooth and decadent...it's a party in your mouth!
Watch out for long lines on weekends! If your order is complicated, you better double check your order when you get it..they tend to forget those extra things you pay for...like extra fudge :) it's recommended I say... whether you're watching your weight or not...Who doesn't want more antioxidants in their diet? That's gotta be healthy!  =)
author: A P.

description: Kharlil & Maurice were thee best guys to ever serve ice cream or dessert period.  No I don't know these guys honestly personally but they seem to enjoy their job & have a great personality about them that go great with their customer service.  They let us try some things & made sure it was a right choice for us before we purchased.  So a nice experience & cool workers.  Thanks again fellas!
author: Oliver Q.

description: Large assortment of Ghiradelli chocolates and other items.  Delicious.
author: Brian B.

description:
A little bit overrated. The problem I had was not with the ice cream and chocolate, but rather with the overall quality of service. From such restaurant, I was expecting slightly cleaner settings for people to enjoy their ice cream, however, overall, the service seemed messy as we had to locate our own seats and waiters were simply running around giving ice cream to people.

A better system would be one that could minimize the chaos that seems to ensure, such as assigning locations for people to sit in. On though this may seem somewhat contradictory to the -on-the-go part, this could facilitate a more professional ambiance for its customers and also staff. 

Overall, I would still recommend that people give this place a try, simply due to the quality of the food. Something important to note is that the portions are relatively large and they are much more suited for groups of 2 people to eat one helping.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Okay.. so you have no doubt had Ghiradelli Chocolate before, right? Well this is like the house of Ghiradelli!

So this is really all you need to know, if you are looking to have some seriously yummy ice cream - this is the place!

My faves are the banana split and the rootbeer float!

Have someone go in the exit on the street while you order and stake out a table, this is the best way to get a good one by the time you get your goodies. There are tables outside, but I prefer inside where the sun won't melt my ice cream before I can enjoy it.

Don't wear your best out fit, it gets pretty messy - the sodas are tall, so if you order one, keep in mind its going to be large! Like the old fashioned soda fountain glasses.

The great thing about this location is that after you gorge yourself, you can walk up and down the hills being a tourist and work it off. :)

Oh, there are some great waterfront views from here too depending on where you walk after you get your goodies...
author: Corey Tess T.

description: I had the sundae and that ghirardelli chocolate was amazing in the ice cream. The wait and lines are pretty long but that's a given since it's a tourist joint. I paid for a water bottle and forgot it and didn't get a reciept. I told one of the servers and he happily gave me a bottle.
author: Shaun D.

description:
GHIRARDELLI
If you like chocolate, Ghirardelli is another acronym for chocolate heaven! If you're looking for the chocolate factory, this is the place for you! One part chocolate shop and one part ice cream shop, Ghirardelli will certainly satisfy your sweet tooth one way or another. Lots of chocolate varieties to choose from and numerous ice cream choices from the menu. The ice cream sundays are huge, which makes coming in groups the smart thing to do or to share one with your loved one on a romantic night. The ice cream is a bit too soft for my preference, but the sheer amount and variety of toppings makes up for it. While enjoying your sweets, look around the shop to see he various machines that make the famous chocolate that is enjoyed worldwide. SWEET SWEET SWEET!!!
author: Stanley C.

description:
Had the ice cream in a waffle chocolate-dipped bowl. Both ice cream flavours were amazing!! 

5 stars: Ghirardelli Chocolate & Espresso Chip. SO YUMMY!
author: Crystal W.

description: "To Die For!" quote from my Wife!  A fantasy come true when you're a true chocolate lover... I could not get her out of the store - and everywhere we went, she was showing off her 'Ghirardelli' shopping bag. Love it.
author: Rick G.

description: Perfect place to grab ice cream treats on the go. I would recommend buying your treats and then enjoying them in the park across the street if it is a nice day out. That's what we did the 2nd time we came by during our week long trip here. I would recommend the ice cream sundae with hot fudge and the thick chocolate milkshake since they were soooo delicious! I had to stop coming by this side of town so I wouldn't be tempted to snack here all week long!
author: Brian P.

description: The yahoos making sundaes here could not possibly be slower. With a massive line stretching out the door and down the street, they're turning out one sundae every five minutes. Totally ridiculous.
author: Dave K.

description:
Oh god, why is it SOOOOO GOOOOOD?

I want to hate ghirardelli so much! For a number of reasons:
     - They're so snobby
     - Overpriced
     - Always crowded 
     - In the city (toll fees for me)
     - Tourist attraction
     - No parking

I've always avoided these SF tourist attractions. If I do go, it's pretty much never by my own choice, that, or I'm already in the area.

I happen to be in the area because I was at the SnowBomb Ski Fest at Fort Mason and thought that we'd do a last minute date night for some ice cream. It would be both our first times. Line looks horrible, but it moved quickly. The real wait is waiting for your ice cream to get to the table. 

Charming little place. It's so homey. It could've been snowing outside with Christmas music playing. We had a tough time finding a table, but once we did, an old man with an twirly mustache came to wipe the tables and semi-serve us. He was such a charming old man! He asked us where we're from and told us some history of Ghirardelli! 

(*Did you know Ghirardelli lived in Piedmont, even though the factory is in SF? He is also burried in the East Bay!) *pats myself on the head*

We ordered a brownie sundae and got it with strawberry cheesecake ice cream and the ghirardelli chocolate ice cream. The strawberry cheesecake was SOO GOOD! Complete with real globs of cheesecake and dried strawberries (the ones in cereals). The ghirardelli chocolate was rich and smooth. Both were great choices. 

The relatively small cup costed about $10 and was worth the first time try, not a frequent one though. Thank god we both didn't have too big of a sweet tooth and had enough to share.
author: Azn B.

description:
This is the place to be if you want an amazing, scrumptious chocolate sundae AND if you wanna pay $37 for it. Let's get real here. The place is located at Ghiradelli Square (shocking right?) and more tourists flock to this spot than almost any other spot in town. I've been a few times and I think I waited like an hour and change to get my digits on a peanut butter sundae. Honestly, it was well worth the wait b/c it's that good. Now, seating is a joke. You pretty much run around and stand next to the person who has the least ice cream left in their bowl and hope they don't sit around after they finish and play grab ass all night. (That's code for good luck finding a seat) I love it though. I don't love it enough to show up here every single time I need an ice cream fix (that's why I have Bi Rite kids) but I do love to come by at least twice a year and get down with it. 

It's overpriced like a mo fo, no doubt, but it's so damn good!!!
author: Hector G.

description: A must go place, any time of the year you are in the city a visit to Ghirardelli should be made. Great variety of ice-creams and sundaes
author: Sahil C.

description:
Not bad.  Love the ice cream.
Pricey, but you don't eat here everyday, so hey.

Gets points off for:
sticky tables that need to be cleaned
not a lot of seating

Felt like I had to elbow my way to a table there.
author: Shaunita J.

description:
For what this place is, I give it a 4 star, considering what it really is.

Let me just start with this... This is a HUGE Tourist Attraction.

With that said, be ready to spend some time here (and by time, I mean waiting in line).

Depending on what you are indulging in, chocolate, ice cream or both, you are going to have to wait.  This place is definitely a madhouse, but that is to be expected for being a tourist attraction.  They have some pretty crazy looking concoctions as far as ice cream and milkshakes go.  I simply ordered a cone with 2 scoops to keep it simple and cheap.

The chocolate is of course the Ghiradelli brand, so the chocolate ice cream and hot fudge are pretty much on point.  Everything else is meant to be a draw in for tourists.  

The workers could use pep up some, but just some of them.  The people at the registers seemed like drones, but when you have to take that many orders, I guess you have to just stay in work mode.  Don't get me wrong, a little smile and a nice greeting would definitely help people feel welcome, not just "Hi, what would you like."  The people at the doors handing out samples of chocolate seemed to have that part down.  Smile, warm greeting, ask if we would like a free sample and asked if we had any questions.

All things considered, this is definitely a place you want to visit at least once while you're in San Francisco.  It's a tourist attraction afterall.  If I were to live in SF, I might take people from out of town there, otherwise, I would prob go to another local joint and get something cheaper.  

Ah, the power of tourist attractions...
author: Tyler P.

description:
When we go to SF we always come here to have a treat, and normally it's really good and even though the place is always packed the service is good too. But this last time we were there, was terrible! Our food that we got was good, we order the Cookie Bottom thingy, I didn't want two scoops of just vanilla ice cream so we instead got one scoop of Cookies n Cream and one of Rocky Road. They gave us more Rocky Road ice cream than Cookies n Cream. Plus wayyy more whipped cream too.

Here's the thing though...we waited for just that one item for about 25 mins!!! We came with friends and they ordered right before us, we'll they got theirs first of course so I thought within the next five mins I should get mine...NOPE! They were done with theirs and we still didn't get ours...I had the BF go check to see what was up and the workers told him its coming up. We waited...I saw people who came in after us get theirs...so we still waited, after waiting for about five mins more, I had it. The BF goes up to see what's taking so long, they told him again "It's coming up." He told them how long we've been waiting and I guess they HAD to make it right then in there cuz he came back with it. I was mad though! I know the place was super busy, but I've been there before when it's been super busy and I didn't have to wait THAT long for one item! I couldn't believe it. There was a family of like I think 8 who sat @ a table next to us...they ordered 7 items and got it before us, that made me kinda want to just get my money back. 

The workers were kinda rude too. When we were waiting for a table to open up, we of course were standing in the way. Well this one worker, an older lady, had an order and she was looking for the number right. Well I wasn't really in the way, I was standing by the stairs and she comes by doesn't even say excuse me and bumps into me. I say excuse me out loud and she just looks @ me with a dirty look like "well if you weren't in 'my' way that wouldn't have happened." I know having a job sucks, but you don't need to show it. Suck it up!!! People are going there to have a good experience, A LOT of tourists, not to mention. If you don't like how it is there, then quit!! 

I would give this place four stars, but thinking about it, I don't think they deserve it. I would give three and a half but since there isn't a half star up there, they only get three stars.
author: Akemi H.

description: What's better than enjoying a HUGE ice cream facing the bay?
author: Giacomo C.

description:
perfect place to come for some desserts after a date dinner
even though its suuuuper crowded here.. think of sitting down with your date while sharing a sundae that you get $1 off for just checking into yelp. lol the ice cream sundaes really do hit the spot, not too sweet, just the right dessert.
pair your sundae with a seasalt caramel hot cocoa! ohhh man.. that really hits the spot..
author: Holly V.

description:
Upside? The banana split is delicious, make sure to ask for extra fudge!

Downside? Crowded as a sardine can, a very touristy spot. 

Cool place to visit though. You can indulge in a variety of ice creams, then watch how chocolate and cones are made, and finally shop for some chocolate. The beach is a block down so it's perfect for taking a walk to burn off I'd say about 1% of the calories you probably just consumed!
author: Julia F.

description: Got the world famous sundae - kinda boring. Lots of seating. Easy location.  Worse part was this place didn't have a restroom to wash your hands at. I asked where I could wash my hands and the dude gave me a napkin he dipped in water.  Classy AF.
author: Sarah U.

description: A must try if your in San Francisco.  They offer coffee, hot chocolate and ice cream at this location.  Decided to give the ice cream a try and it was super yummy.  Service was good, even got a free piece of chocolate.
author: Monica T.

description: Don't get me wrong - the ice cream and chocolate at Ghirardelli is amazing.  My chocolate shake I ordered was beyond good, but the service was not.  There was one pleasant girl behind the counter making the sundaes, but there was no organization behind the counter.  The girls taking orders were taking more orders than they had people to make the desserts.  Specially the guy tasked to make my shake was then tasked to do a bunch of little things, moving trash, refilling coke in ice bucket etc that he did all before coming back to make the shakes.  They were also giving wrong orders out.  30 minutes later I got my shake.  Like I said - great desserts no organization.
author: Serena C.

description: I've been here a few times but this last time really opened my eyes. There is absolutely nothing special about this place. Went here 3 weeks ago after dinner and waiting for about an hour in line for a less then mediocre Sunday where I watched them take my frozen brownie from a box and microwave it. Not sure what we are really paying for besides mediocre ice cream basically just paying for the name. Don't waste your money here there are much better dessert places in the city!
author: Maryann M.

description: I always hit this place up whenever I'm in the touristy mood.  The sundaes are just so good.  There's nothing too special about them.. except everything goes together so well!  Pocket your free sample chocolate and order a sundae!  -2 stars for getting rid of the peanut butter squares.  WHY?!  Those were my favorite!  Bring it back!  Please?
author: Irene C.

description: Felt like having ice cream so just had a large cone - was just ok. Probably should have gone with a sundae instead!
author: Katheriin L.

description:
This ice cream shop is amazing! I don't normally like chocolate or ice cream for that matter, but the melted chocolate in the sundae is pure decadence. 

The classic sundae, warm brownie sundae, banana ice cream sundae and the gold rush are all items on the menu you must try. Anything with melted Ghirardelli chocolate is guaranteed to satisfy. Pass on anything without the chocolate! But be warned - the chocolate melts the ice cream a little by the time you get it, so it will get quite messy.

Also - it's usually pretty busy, but I never have too much trouble finding a seat. I usually go during off peak hours though :T
author: Thy L.

description:
I got their coffee ice cream in a cup with a brownie. 

Their coffee ice cream was amazing! I want to say it was better than Haagen Dazs coffee ice cream (which is my favorite)!  

Their brownie however was pretty bad... I don't know how but the texture was soggy... I did like the loads of chocolate chips in it though :) 

The service was also great! I had my order taken by a very friendly cashier and the server was also very friendly :) 

If you're craving sweets look no further ~
author: Esther S.

description: 4th of July was stupid 40 minutes to get my order then it cam out wrong when I asked for the right order some tall lurchy guy asked me to leave then came from around the corner like he was going to physically remove me about the time an altercation was taking place with someone else yelling at him the other person gave me my order and I left what a zoo two people ringing up orders and one scooping ice cream one watching and one person on break didn't work out for them or the customers to well pretty poor.
author: Kevin R.

description:
This place gets crowded during typical tourist times (seasons, evenings, etc.), but the free candy is always being handed out and they wear cool chocolatier hats. 

Gotta go if it's your first time in SF, otherwise not worth elbowing through the crowds to weave through the store (just go straight to the ice cream bar for the sundaes).
author: Annie L.

description:
What can I say?  We're at Ghirardelli Square, so why not get Ghirardelli Chocolate Sundae?  Yum! Yum! Yum!  A little pricey, but it's a tourist trap.  I'm on vacation, so what the heck!  Sundae and hot chocolate, here I come!

The sundae is quite large.  Enough to share for two, or three.  But if you don't want to share, all 5,000+ calories is all yours!

We got the Very Berry Sunday and Lombard Hot Chocolate.  Sundae was divine!  The whipped cream is soooo goood!  So thick and creamy!  Ice cream with the berry sauce - oh so good!  Hot chocolate wasn't what I expected though.  It was just steamed milk with four pieces of Ghirardelli milk chocolate squares you open and put it in the steamed milk to make your desired chocolate-y taste.

We're on vacation, so I think we deserved it, especially since we were walking off all the calories!

BTW, if you walk into the store (just next door), they give you a free regular piece of G-chocolate!
author: JME C.

description: This is a really awesome place to grab an expensive ice cream dish or expensive chocolate. I really like that you get to splurge here once in a while. I always have only come here with friends when we are in the area. It's a great place to visit at SF. Validation for parking is only 1hr and it is with a purchase of $20+
author: Diana C.

description: Delicious but the wait is too long outside and inside. I waited one hour for two hot chocolates. Once you stand in the long line outside and after you order, it takes another 20-30 min to get the order. They need to hire Starbucks employees to know how to deal with fast pace and lots of people.
author: Monica S.

description:
Personally a very overcrowded place for ...ok ice cream. But it's a great tourist hit. And it's always enjoyable with a friend.
So every time one of my out of town friends are here in sf, I stop by Ghirardelli for some ice cream.
Famous. Decent. Great Scenery.
The ice cream is refreshing on a hot SF day or a long day of walking or biking :)
author: Missy W.

description: I went here to the 801 Beach St location.  A bit of a line, popular place.  Awesome employees, very friendly.  I got a two scoop chocolate cone for $5.25.  It was delicious.  Prices here are really high, that's my main complaint (like the bags of chocolate squares).  Store was clean and it was a nice place to sit down and look at Alcatraz in the distance.  Some of the aluminum chairs are super noisy also, that was really annoying, the sound of them scraping on the floor, they need to fix that.  At one point I was eating the cone and I thought that the ice cream tasted identical to Häagen-Dazs, but then it tasted a little different, maybe even a little better than Häagen-Dazs.  I love Häagen-Dazs so it's not really a problem.  I would go back here for sure, good place to take tourists and San Franciscans who like to pretend to be tourists once in awhile.  =)
author: Cynthia B.

description:
the chocolate fudge here is great.. it was soo tasty i'm pretty sure i didn't breath during this seating.. lol i literally shallow the whole hot fudge sunday... kinda felt bad for my friend who was trying to take a pic.. and only gotten a few bits... actually, i would still do it again! LMAO she should remember the saying "if you don't eat fast you don't eat!" LOL

would i come back? absolutely!!! this time i would order one just by myself...
author: Van H.

description:
This place is like Willy Wonka!! lol I love the hot chocalate its so good! they even have a spicy hot choclate yum! the chocolate is everywhere lol you can't excape it! its HUGE!! Luckly the waitor liked me and gave me this really nice purple velvet pouch with goodies in it lol!!

Good times!
author: Tawny P.

description:
Good staff. Delicious desserts. Had the banana split. They ran out of bananas so I didn't get full experience. Only gave $1 discount. 

Would return to try again. With Bananas or better discount, would def give 5 stars.
author: Ashley K.

description: Really good and sweet desserts. Excellent chocolate, great service. What more could you ask for?
author: Matthew W.

description: It is fitting that is review #100 for me... Ghirardelli. I got a hot fudge sundae which, while quite pricey ($9.50 in a waffle bowl) was to die for! The hot fudge was sooo good. I had a choice between dark and milk - I went with milk. I didn't actually finish the ice cream, I was just very focused on the hot fudge. I think this is a must, if you like good chocolate, that is.
author: Tammy S.

description:
FREE CHOCOLATE SAMPLES.

My friends and I were tempted to wear a disguise (perhaps a moustache or oversized sunglasses) so we could keep coming back in to collect samples of those decandent squares of milk chocolate caramel and chocolate toffee. Mmm. Maybe it was the 2 hours we spent chugging, err "sipping", Rose' and Chard next door at Cellar 360 - sweets taste so much better after booze.

The place itself is small but efficient. They sell Ghirardelli chocolate gift boxes/gift towers ($10 and up) but the place also doubles as an ice cream shop. Lines can get long on weekends, but they move rather quickly. The smell of fresh waffle cones is intoxicating. Next time you're in Ghirardelli Square, I dare you to walk past this place and take a whiff of those waffle cones and resist going in.
author: Mariela D.

description:
So Disappointed!! I've come here as a little kid and loved it but I took a 6yr old boy I was babysitting here last night and can't believe how far below par the ice cream was.

My ice cream was super soft, like it was left out all day. The ice cream at the bottom of the glass had ice in it! Disgusting. The only good part about my desert was the whipped cream and fudge.
author: Kate J.

description:
Totally cliche SF tourist spot and totally worth it :)

I felt like I was in a movie walking up to Ghirardelli square in the evening with the lights bright and shiny.  Since it was 77 degrees I sat outside by the fountain in the square.  There is indoor patio seating and seating upstairs as well.  Order at the counter and then have it brought to you after they find you via number pallet.

Ordered the plain milk hot chocolate with a little whip cream.  Really good and very sweet (just how I like it).  I had the banana split a previous time and will be sure to split it with two other people instead of just one since its so much sweet for one!

Recommend this place to tourists.
author: Rimi K.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! What's not to love? It's chocolate Mecca.
Don't be disappointed if you walk up and the line is around the building. The 'to go" door(around the corner) has got the 'to go' process down to a science.
This is one of the Must See, Must Indulge places of San Francisco. On previous visits I have eaten in the Ice Cream Shop, but I much prefer getting my treat to go and sitting out at the park in front of the Square and gazing out at the Golden Gate Bridge and the bay.
author: Julie M.

description: This spot is a nice chocolate place. When you enter, they give you a free sample of chocolate. There are many choices and varieties. I decided to take advantage of their services and ordered a fountain ice cream float. The location is amazing and you can get a view of Alcatraz.
author: Josh W.

description:
Okay free chocolate sample? Check.
Ice cream? Check.
Water view? Check, and check.
Pricey for some ice cream...well, yeah, but it's an ~experience~!

A must for any SF visit. 

Someday I will bathe in a vat of their chocolate fudge and then I will be able to die happy (fat).

Seating is kinda meh, and the tables weren't bussed very well because of the scramble to sit whenever there was space, but that damn chocolate fudge makes up for any downsides in seating...
author: Natasha T.

description: Slowest service EVER! How about having more than one person making ice cream when the line is out the door.  Huge tourist trap, be ready to wait 30+minutes for ice cream...not worth it!
author: Tiff D.

description: Met an interesting and informative and helpful busboy on my latest visit...
author: Kislev A.

description: Complete tourist trap.  Worlds most overpriced brownie sundae.  For $10 - a smallish sundae in a huge glass dish.  It is deceiving.  Absolutely not worth it.
author: Brian P.

description:
This is the place we always take our out of the area guests.
The chocolate is to die for.
Always crowded; need to be patient.
author: Rosquete B.

description: Great historical place, not to mention the sweets available every day.  It's conveniently located in Fisherman's, right next to the Hyde Cable Car station.  They give free caramel chocolate samples at all shops!
author: Rhonald N.

description: The employees working that night had zero sense of urgency and zero motivation to get ice cream out the door.  Management needs to hire a consulting team (or Chef Ramsay) to streamline their process (or simply get their asses in gear!)  If there's a line, don't get in it.
author: Sara S.

description: Ghiradelli is chocolate dream paradise! The sea salt hot cocoa was a bit too sweet, even medium size. A small would have been enough. Still a fab place to have chocolate from the source!!! A must visit for any tourist and even the locals. However, a good wdlk can fix this all :)
author: Christa B.

description: Great ice cream in a cool location near fishermans wharf.  My favorite place to get an ice cream sundae!
author: Kenyon S.

description:
If you are looking for a heath food place and are counting your calories, prepare to backslide.  but GO IN!    I had a classic sundae in a house made waffle cone.  and it was GOOD.  I think I am still trying to burn that thing off, but I don't regret it.   The chocolate milling gear on the first floor is a nice touch.  It was fun to see chocolate being milled and processed, but then again, I like such things.  Anyway, this is a top notch operation, the food was fantastic and fun.  So definitely go here.  (if you get the earthquake sundae, you have my respect...especially if you eat if by yourself and finish it.... wow...)
Enjoy!
author: Jeff P.

description: Duh....everytime I order ice cream here, it is melted already, not only that, a scoop of chocolate ice cream comes with vanilla mixed in it!!!! But it tastes soooooooooo gooooooood~~~~ coffee and chocolate ice cream are a perfect combo! Coffee tastes really buttery and chocolaty, yum..... Gave them 4stars just because my ice cream was melted....(^_^;;)
author: Yona P.

description: The cookie bottom sundae was good until you made your way to the cookie which was rock hard and almost impossible to eat.  I was actually very disappointed.
author: Kevin H.

description: This Ghirardelli-on-the-go is the way to go. I am not a tourist. I live in San Francisco. I do love me some Ghirardelli ice cream and when I get the cravings for it, I prefer to come here. The service is way faster than the one upstairs. They do serve exactly the same thing so no need to worry. Recently, I tried their brownie sundae, and it was just amazing. So what if it's a touristy place, it doesn't really matter because they are pretty good.
author: J C.

description: I ordered an ice cream soda float and it was delicious and decadent.  all of their sundaes are really incredible.   The prices are comprable to other Ghirardelli shops - like it wasn't more at Ghirardelli square vs. San Diego gaslamp district.  And I only had to wait a minute before a table for my party of 6 to be seated and having the table bussed.
author: Jill L.

description: Yes, I realize how touristy it is to go here but OH MY GOSH IT'S SO DELICIOUS.  Those sundays and banana splits are to die for and I never get tired of watching the chocolate mixer thingy.  I fantasize about jumping in.
author: Britt B.

description: Got the golden gate. The ice cream was delicious and the pineapples were a nice touch not usually seen on a sundae. Otherwise it had fudge, bananas, strawberry chunks and a cherry on top. $10 . I thought it was worth it but my husband didn't think so. It is very pricey but overall I would definitely be back!!!  When I arrived there was only 1 person in line but that's probably because it was a cold day. Awesome first experience and delicious chocolate!
author: Suzy H.

description: the chocolate is as good as it is, and the people there were pretty friendly too! everything is creamy and thick ;) they gave us a huge scoop of ice cream too!! got our moneys worth!!
author: Ru C.

description: Yum Chocolate! We went here on a Friday night, and it was packed. They were super quick to bring out our ice cream, and it was great. Check it out; it will be worth your while.
author: Brooke W.

description: The cheapest sundae was ten bucks and the "whipped cream" was really weird. It is hard to screw up a hot fudge sundae but it was not that great. Later I went up the stairs and the other Ghiardelli's seemed much cleaner and classier and they had more stuff so the downstairs joint may just be for dumbos (like me ) who don 't know about the options above.
author: Lesley P.

description: Touristy site! Split one HUGE ice cream sundae among 4 people. The fudge was nice and warm- very addictive. Surprisingly I liked it for not being too into sweets :)
author: Jamie T.

description: I'm conflicted here.  1st night had the butterscotch-fudge sundae & it was 4 stars.  Returned the next night for the Rocky Road sundae & was really disappointed - only put a teaspoonful of hot fudge on it, seriously stingy!   Also why does a premium topping place have dryers  ice cream???   Why not use the local classic Fentons or Double Rainbow, seriously time to call quality control!
author: Aaron W.

description: You need to get the classic hot choc.. So delish!
author: Robin D.

description: Get ready to spend $9 on a reg Hot fudge sundae that's comparable to Mcdonalds. Friends ordered the small White Choc. Mocha, ($4.25) thinking their 'chocolate' flavor would blow Starbucks out of the water. They both said it tasted like good old fashion coffee, extra bitter no 'oomph' at all. They were too shy to ask for a refund, so I did in a very polite manner.The cashier asked me what was wrong with it, I said "Its not what I expected, a too bitter for my taste." Cashier grabbed the barely-english-speaking 'supervisor' and she told me "We're a chocolate shop, not coffee shop. Starbucks right there not very far! " UNBELIEVABLE. No one in my party was impressed. BEST part was the free sample of salty chocolate they give you. Yum!
author: Laken B.

description: All I can say, if ur on a diet....do not enter!  The Bay Bridge Brownie Sundae was spectacular drizzled in milk chocolate....so amazing!!!
author: Debra A.

description: So I decided to go here because its a good place if you want good ice cream. I have been here before on a weekend and must say its almost impossible to find a spot because it gets sooo busy. But this time I was on a Tuesday around 8pm and it was perfect not that many people and quite. My friend had the Hot Fudge and I got the Very Berry which were both very delicious. Would definitely go again to Ghirardelli for an evening of desert.
author: Anton P.

description:
i was introduced to the ghirardelli chocolate chip cookie at a giant's game. o m f g. what giant's game?!

eating a gigantic 4x4inch ghirardelli frozen chocolate chip cookie is one of my favorite things to do when i feel like being a fatass. almost breaking my teeth biting off big chunks, and then letting them slowly melt in my mouth...is just bomb

this 1.5 inch thick cookie makes me so happy. it tastes like a super dense shortbread with chocolate chips. the outside is crispy and golden brown...and as you get closer and closer to the center, you can taste the butter flavor getting stronger and stronger. and when you reach the middle, the buttery and sugary taste is so wonderful that you just want to buy a bunch and hoard them in your freezer.
author: Jessica C.

description: This is a must do in San Francisco!  If you are brave, order the earthquake sundae!!!
author: Liss J.

description: Ahh... the Ghirardelli Square in SF.  How do you beat their flagship?  They were handing out Pumpkin spice Caramel squares... wow!  I was impressed.  It's not teuscher chocolate but it's better than most!  Nice mall.. in the middle of some construction so couldn't enjoy the whole thing and wish they would give us chocolate lovers a place to sit and enjoy the harbor view while enjoying their treats!
author: Jack L.

description:
YUM! Free Coffee with Croissant purchase!  
Located down 3 flights of stairs from the main Chocolate (Tourist Trap, btw).
This cute litte of-shoot is a great place to stop in early am before you start out on your big walk day!
The chocolate croissant was AMAZING!!  WOW.
author: LINDA R.

description: This is a review exclusively for their chocolate chip cookie, since I've never been able to convince myself into trying anything else. These cookies are softball sized and almost as dense as a softball. Simply amazing. I get one every time I come to the city. You've got to try it.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I ordered a hot chocolate but would like to substitute their usual milk chocolate squares with dark chocolate instead.  That's a simple thing - nothing else - just a substitution for the same chocolate - just from milk to dark -  with the SAME PRICE.  
The manager was very inflexible about it, and after repeating myself three times about the request, she declared that I might as well order the Decadent chocolate, because they use dark chocolate for it.  When I relented and said I will order what she suggested, she then warned me that it's almost like drinking melted chocolate - which is fine, except for the harsh and irritated way she said it.  That was it - I told her that it was not going to work for me, even though the guy at the cash register was very nice.  She seemed to not want to deal with me because I just don't order off the menu.  We still bought our kids their sundaes even though I didn't want to do business with this particular cafe anymore.  The other guy slipped in a small dark chocolate square for me, which was very nice of him. AT least they have somebody who knows what REASONABLE customer care is - which is why I gave one star.  He deserves to be in charge, and not that girl. He was very nice to everybody.   The manager however, needs more training in customer care - especially how to refer to customers.  She barked at the other customers, about going outside to eat at the tables, and shooed a lady out with a dog.  You know, you can be firm about rules but you SHOULD be nice and considerate about it, especially when the people still want to have some ice cream treats on a cold day.  They are patronizing the product - so take care of them, because they are the reason why you, girl,  have a job.  I worked in the front lines of a bank and a big store chain so I know what customer care is all about.  Thanks for reading this.
author: Cee B.

description: the best ice cream/desert in the bay! dark fudge sundae is what I always get and I can have this every day of my life. Seriously. The most uplifting atmosphere, great location. The customer service isn't as good as it used to be, but honestly, it doesn't matter all that much! WANT NOW
author: Zeenat U.

description: Is this the same as what they serve upstairs?  I wasn't impressed at all.  The ice cream was terrible.  Maybe I don't like ice cream anymore, but I wouldn't go back.  It wasn't even really ice cream.  I think it came out of a soft serve machine?  In fact, it tasted just like the ice cream I get the kids a Sweet Tomatoes Salad bar. Very suspicious.
author: Chris D.

description: hot cocoa on a cold night with SC, sisters & friends
author: sha e.

description: very busy place , try not to go on busy days try to get there before 12noon on week days  service is compromised when busy .. other then that great place .......
author: Ftamike H.
